content.rendered:
• What information do you want from people who report to you?

title.rendered: Product Knowledge 10 day ideas

content.rendered:
• Spend 30 minutes a day practicing a new teaching method: class structure, body language, phrases, etc.
  • Learn and teach one new use for products each week.
  • Learn and teach one new product/kit each week.
  • Organize games, contests, or “research” by applying a product every day and measuring changes. Report weekly results and findings to the team.
  • Learn one new technology medium for presentations, and practice 30 minutes every day.
  • Attend one class per week presented by upline or other leaders, and identify at least one change to my presentations.
  • Study the most popular products, and identify at least one new use I currently do not focus on: application, seasonal, blends and combinations, etc.
  • Schedule time on weekly call agenda to review new products and uses with team.

excerpt.rendered:
Spend 30 minutes a day practicing a new teaching method: class structure, body language, phrases, etc. Learn and teach one new use for products each week. title.rendered: Product Knowledge Step 2 DQ know enough

content.rendered:
• How can you tell if you know enough about the product or enough about teaching?
  • What are the signs that a person does not know enough about the product?
  • If leaders do not hold classes or close well in the classes, do you think that suggests they do not know enough about the product or about teaching?
  • Do you have specific learning goals?
  • What do you know about using visual aids to teach?
  • Have you talked with a more experienced person to learn how this person presents and demonstrates the effectiveness of the products?
  • Do you believe that the more you know, the more confident you will feel?
  • Do you encourage people in your classes to tell about their successes with the products?
  • What are your favorite products, and which products do you share the most?
  • What are you currently doing to emphasize the need for continued learning?

content.rendered:

title.rendered: Boost leaders step 6 ID Every monday

content.rendered:
• Every Monday, I will ask my leaders to set new goals to help them progress. Then I will check in with them the next week to see how many of them are working on their goals.
  • Twice a month, I will measure my leaders’ volume and enrollments to see if they are increasing.
  • At our trainings, I will ask each leader how many potential customers they talked to that week.
  • I will measure the number of positive stories or results shared at our team meetings to see if they increase each week.
  • Each week I will measure if results are improving after I’ve reduced or eliminated external rewards.
  • Every Thursday, I will track the rate of volume, new builder enrollments, loyalty enrollments, and/or rank goals to measure if they are increasing faster.
  • I will assess our weekly team meetings and measure if complaints and blaming are reduced among my team.
  • Each week I will track the number of times my leaders solve problems on their own without—or with less of—my help.

title.rendered: Boost leaders 10 day ID

content.rendered:
• Share at least one win or positive experience or observation in every conversation I have each day.
  • Build trust with my team by getting to know my leaders and builders on a more personal level.
  • Refine weekly strategy calls with upline and downline leaders to focus on a more clear understanding of expectations, goals, and how we want to help each other.
  • Make sure less experienced builders and leaders have enough support and ideas to make the daily success habits of contacting and following up easier and more effective.
  • Attend a sales training webinar with my top leaders so we are learning something together.
  • Match my rewards and incentives to what my leaders like.
  • Match rewards and incentives to long-term growth instead of short-term goals.
  • Have an online “party” to celebrate the wins in my team.
  • Communicate so all leaders and builders understand how their contributions support our goals for growth.

title.rendered: Boost Leaders Step 3 ID Delegate

content.rendered:
• I will delegate assignments to my leaders that require genuine effort and opportunity for them.
  • I will focus more on developing leadership skills in my leaders.
  • I will keep my focus on the defined direction I have selected until I see the progress I want to see.
  • I will meet with team members, and together we will organize a set of goals designed to increase their motivation.
  • I will follow up, encourage, and reward improved diligence in my leaders.
  • I will identify and resolve reasons for a lack of motivation—lack of or misdirected effort, lack of understanding how to do things, poor communication, etc.
  • I will learn new ways to motivate.
  • I will refer others to 6i Catalyst so they can learn and be motivated too.
  • I will work to build trust. I will be consistent and supportive and lead by example. I will do what I say I will do.
  • I will invite more participation from others to generate commitment and a sense ownership.
  • I will communicate more positive results and experiences.
